instruction_text:
To diagnose and optimize slow laptop performance:

1. Check resource usage:
   - Open Task Manager (Ctrl+Shift+Esc)
   - Check CPU, Memory, Disk usage
   - Identify processes using high resources
   - Sort by CPU or Memory usage

2. Check startup programs:
   - Task Manager > Startup tab
   - Disable unnecessary startup programs
   - Only keep essential programs
   - Restart computer after changes

3. Check disk space:
   - This PC > Check C: drive space
   - Free up space if low (need 15-20% free)
   - Use Disk Cleanup tool
   - Remove unnecessary files

4. Run disk cleanup:
   - Search 'Disk Cleanup'
   - Select drive and scan
   - Delete temporary files, recycle bin, etc.
   - Clean system files (Run as administrator)

5. Check for malware:
   - Run Windows Defender full scan
   - Update antivirus definitions
   - Run additional malware scan (Malwarebytes)
   - Remove any detected threats

6. Update Windows:
   - Settings > Update & Security
   - Check for updates
   - Install all pending updates
   - Restart if required

7. Check disk health:
   - Run: wmic diskdrive get status
   - Check for disk errors
   - Run disk check: chkdsk C: /f /r
   - Replace drive if failing

8. Defragment disk (HDD only):
   - Search 'Defragment'
   - Analyze disk first
   - Defragment if needed (not for SSDs)

9. Optimize SSD (if applicable):
   - Settings > System > Storage
   - Configure Storage Sense
   - Enable TRIM for SSD

10. Disable visual effects:
    - System Properties > Advanced > Performance Settings
    - Choose 'Adjust for best performance'
    - Or customize and disable animations

11. Check for memory leaks:
    - Monitor memory usage over time
    - Identify applications consuming increasing memory
    - Update or reinstall problematic applications

12. Update drivers:
    - Device Manager
    - Update graphics drivers
    - Update chipset drivers
    - Restart after updates

13. Increase virtual memory:
    - System Properties > Advanced > Performance Settings
    - Advanced tab > Virtual memory
    - Adjust paging file size
    - Set to system managed or custom size

14. Check power settings:
    - Control Panel > Power Options
    - Use 'High performance' plan
    - Adjust advanced power settings
    - Prevent USB selective suspend

15. Clean browser cache:
    - Clear browser cache and cookies
    - Remove browser extensions
    - Check browser memory usage

16. Check for background processes:
    - Task Manager > Details tab
    - Sort by CPU/Memory
    - End unnecessary processes
    - Identify resource-hungry applications

17. Reinstall Windows (last resort):
    - Backup important data
    - Reset Windows or clean install
    - Restore from backup

18. Hardware upgrade considerations:
    - Add more RAM if possible
    - Upgrade to SSD if using HDD
    - Clean internal components (dust)
    - Check if overheating causing throttling
